title: Jhin Q bounce bug
body:
Happened to me ever since 6.6

Whenever I throw Jhin's grenade and there's more than 4 targets around the grenade will bounce twice and then disappear even where there are more targets that haven't been hit yet.

Happens about every 1/3 Q's for me
Very frustrating bug because you can't tell if it's going to occur or not, it's just chance and I don't think there's a way to intentionally make it happen.

Bad way to start off your CS game especially since it's hard to CS compared to other champs because he only has 4 auto attacks before he has to reload

replies.body:
OMG thanks for reporting this, I love this champ and is the first one i ever truly tried to main a character. It screwed me over for 2 games at least and it is very annoying to lose the CS as you say.
Linking another thread with a video.

http://boards.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-reports-eu/cg6KJ5aF-jhin-bug-66

Hey Tier 5 Lucian! 

Thanks for the report! We're aware of the issue and are working on a fix. ^-^

There's also a bug with projectiles disappearing that has been around since preseason, are you aware of it?
I think it has to do with movement inputs right at the time of landing, it happened to me while playing Quinn and Jinx. The autoattack projectile flies off and disappears upon contact with the target, I think before doing its contact animation (ex. explosion for Jinx's rockets).

However, I've seen it happen with turret shots too - I mean it's unlikely to be unable to notice a turr shot's damage on an ADC's health bar 8 minutes in, right? And there again, I think the contact red light and sound don't play but I'm not sure.

No reproduction steps that I know, except well that it doesn't happen on melees afaik.
Mmm, personally, no, but that wouldn't be surprising because I'm on skins. :P I'd be happy follow up with Champion, though!
Happened to me yesterday as I played Jhin, it either bounced twice or 3 times
I can confirm, I noticed it earlier today. The q bounce is definitely bugged. Not sure under what conditions though.
